Posts.Content: Dear Mom G: So sorry to hear that you also are experiencing wrist joint pain. It is especially problematic if you are right handed. Sometimes it is even hard for me to pull the covers up at night....after I have kicked them off during a hot flash. I did try switching to Femara but the hot flashes were much more frequent and severe so I went back to Aromasin. I think my wrists are feeling better though. My oncologist suggested that I take Motrin for pain relief. I even tried the wrist supports at night that people use for carpal tunnel. I have another friend who had a bilateral mastectomy and never had chemo or radiation, but was on Arimidex and had the same problems you and I are experiencing. My fear of reoccurence keeps me on the drugs. Hope yours improves with time. I started Aromasin one year ago and just started with the joint pain around February. It does help to know that we are not alone or crazy. Keep the faith.....sometimes it helps to go off of them for awhile, or switch, and then resume.. Good luck. Sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks
Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Hi Denise: How wonderful you found this site inn Dublin. It is a great place to express your fears and concerns. I just finished four doses of dose dense Taxol. I am experiending neuropathy which is primarily in my hands and feet. However, I had numbness in my uppper lip and my face felt "different" to very soft touch. It is gradually improving. We all react different to the drugs. Keep seeking the answers it is healthy. Blessings, Sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks
Posts.Title: New User - Taxol and face pains?

Posts.Content: Dear Andree: Thanks for responding. I have never heard of the axillary web syndrome. I suppose it could occur from radiation and an axillary node dissection. I hope yours is from the Arimidex. My bilateral wrist pain is actually improving. I still have the early morning stiffness in all of my joints especially my feet. Skeetchers are the only shoes I can wear comfortably due to the pain in my feet. the neuropathy is slowly improving and I am still taking Neurotin for it. I will be glad when I can stop taking it. Good health to all who read this....In spirit, Sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks
Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Hi Mary and Karen: Sorry that you are also experiencing joint and muscle pain. It is so frustrating. I posted earlier about the same problem. I really thought I was going crazy with my wrist problem. I still have neuropathy from the Taxol. I am taking Aromasin. I am just hoping that it will eventually get better. I am very stiff in the morning or after sitting for long periods. I wish more people would respond as I think it happens fairly frequently. My oncologist said the joint pain from the chemo lasts about a year, but mine didn't start until I was on the Aromasin for several months. Blessings to you both...you are not alone, Sharon

Posts.Content: Does anyone have any ideas or suggestions about which aromatase inhibitors are reccommended and have the fewest side effects? It seems that Arimidex may have the most research. I am trying to decide which I can tolerate the best. Thanks, Sharon

Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Greetings to all: It has been awhile since I have posted. I saw my oncologist this week and was thrilled to hear NED.....I have waited until I could say this...It has been a year ago that I finished chemo, AC/Taxol. I still have some neuropathy in my hands and feet. I am taking Neurotin and Vit B 6 & 12. However, I do feel that it is slowly improving. I have been taking Aromasin since last June. About three months ago I started to have pain in both of my wrists. I didn't know if it was carpal tunnel or arthritis. It almost feels like it is "catching on something". Sometimes, upon awakening in the morning I can hardly move my left wrist. I have some point tenderness over the wrist bones. The left side is worst than the right. Could the lack of estrogen be causing this related to the Aromasin? Does anyone else have this problem? Am I going to have permanent joint damage? My doctor felt it was not carpal tunnel and just told me to take Motrin. I have adapted more or less to the neuropathy, but this is frustrating. I am generally stiff when I get up in the morning or after an hour in the car. I know other people have said they feel ancient.....after all this treatment with the joint aches and pains, etc. I would love to hear from others who may be experiencing the same problem. Would it help to change Aromatase Inhibitors? or will it eventually go away and if so when...I do take Glucosamine. I am grateful to be alive and done with therapy, but would like to be functioning better. I will continue to take the AI's as it is more than worth it to prevent reoccurence. thanks, Sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks

Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Hello all: I haven't written in awhile as I was writing under newly diagnosed and feel like I am oldly diagnosed now. I have completed the four cycles of AC and have had my first dose of Taxol. They gave me 50 mg of Benadryl, Kytril, and 20 Mg of Decadron prior to the Taxol. I also took 1mg of Ativan orally. All was fine until day four when I broke out in hives on my abdomen which turned into welts. Has anyone had this excperience? The doctor ordered Methylprednisolone in decreasing dosage for 5 days. He said it was a reaction to the Taxol and would take four to five days to resolve./ I am worried about the next dose and if I am going to have more of a reaction. I felt pretty crummy yesterday with nausea and had to take Ativan and Compazine. I thought my stomach problems were going to be over with the Taxol. I am taking Acidex now for the GI problems. Does anyone have any advice or suggestions? I will be soooooo glad when this is over. Sharon
Posts.Title: Taxol/hives

Posts.Content: Hi Georgia: thanks for your reply. I had my second dose of Taxol on Thursday without any problem. The oncologist did put me on decadron 8mg per day x 5 days for the joint and muscle pain which should take care of any hives as well I think. I notice that my cuticles are peeling and will try to keep them lubricated and will use tea tree oil to prevent an infection. Only two more treatments to go. I think my energy is alittle better than when on AC. This is such a ride, I never know what to expect from one day to the next. Sharon

Posts.Title: bone, muscle, and joint pain

Posts.Content: Dear Pastor Rich: How life affirming to celebrate the birth of your first grandchild. I am about in the same cycle as Cathy. I will have my second chemo today, AC. My head is a bit tingly and if I tug on my hair it will come out. I had it cut very short in anticipation of losing it all. It still represents one more loss and saddens me. I can't hide my diagnosis any more. Some people don't seem to get the emotional magnititue of hair loss. It is like you knew it was going to happen so why is it bothering you...duh. It is bothering me and I don't like it. Will I tolerate it? Of, course. Glad that Cathy had very little nausea and your wonderful church women are coming through with a wig which she can tolerate. It is so wonderful to know we are not alone on this cancer path. In love and spirit, Sharon
Posts.Title: FEC100 and hair loss

Posts.Content: Dear Pastor Rich: How life affirming to celebrate the birth of your first grandchild. I am about in the same cycle as Cathy. I will have my second chemo today, AC. My head is a bit tingly and if I tug on my hair it will come out. I had it cut very short in anticipation of losing it all. It still represents one more loss and saddens me. Posts.Title: FEC100 and hair loss

Posts.Content: The neuropathy seems to be getting worse. I have two more doses to go. The oncologist suggested I try Nicotine patches 14 mg. Has anyone ever heard of this? He said most permanent neuropathy only occurs in 1% of patients and it is with 5 or 6 doses. I will be getting 4 doses. Any comments: Sharon
Posts.Title: Taxol and neuropathy

Posts.Content: Dear Shelly: The Taxol is much better tolerated than the AC. That is the good news. There also doesn't seem to be the GI problems associated with the AC. Everyone is different. You might not experience any problems. Apparently LGlutamine is good to take in addition to the B6 and B12. Sharon
Posts.Title: Taxol and neuropathy

Posts.Content: I have just recieved my second dose of taxol. No hives this time, but I started with some mild neuropathy after the first dose. It is worse now and I am conserned that it will progress further with each dose. I have numbness and tingling in my fingers, toes, and ball of my left foot. I am taking B6 and B12. Is there anything else I can do? I don't want this to be a permanent side effect/ How long will it last? Any comments or suggestions will be greatly appreciated. Sharon
Posts.Title: Taxol and neuropathy

Posts.Content: Dear Shelly: The Taxol is much better tolerated than the AC. That is the good news. There also doesn't seem to be the GI problems associated with the AC. Everyone is different. Posts.Title: Taxol and neuropathy

Posts.Content: HI Roxi: Sorry you have had this confusion over the WBC's. Sometimes, I think every person reacts so differently to the cancer treatments that it is hard to predict what is actually normal. My radiation oncologist said that my counts might drop only because my bone marrow bank had been drawn upon 8 times with my A/C and Taxol dose dense treatments. With Neulasta, I always recovered enough to receive my next dose of chemo. However, you can only make so many withdrawls from the bone marrow bank. It made sense to me. I think my counts remain ok and I just completed my 21st treatment. I was also worried about my RBC's as I was anemic throughout my chemo with a HGB in the 10 range. I am now up to 13. I had Aransep shots everytime I got chemo. I do have some fatique now but it is nothing like what I experienced with chemo. Hugs, sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks

Posts.Content: Oh, Martha Anne: How very true.....Youu gave me a good laugh which I truly appreciate. Sharon

Posts.Title: Radiation Therapy and White Blood Count

Posts.Content: Yikes, now I am worried. I received dose dense A/C and Taxol for 16 weeks. I had Neulasta with each dose *8 total. Should I be worried about side effects now. I am 8 weeks out. I know that neulasta is very expensive which may determine who receives it. Kaiser does not include it in their protocols. Patients administer their own Neupogen at home. Since they are a dispensing facility they can do this which is why oncologists in private practice don't do this. I don't know why they couldn't just order it from a pharmacy. However, they would not make any money off of it that way. I am learning about the economics of oncology.
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks
Posts.Title: Dose dense chemo and Neulasta question

Posts.Content: Hi Rachel. What a wonderful, accomodating oncologist you have. It all makes sense. It is difficult to have to play the insurance game. Everyone has to know all the ways to best help the patient. I am blessed to have excellent insurance. I think my first three months of chemo ran about $18,000. The Neulasta worked fine for me. I am just left with peripheral neuropathy from the Taxol. Neurotin does help and I just pray that it will gradually resolve even though it may take a year. It was my oncologist's wife who told me about the reimbursement issue and the need to prescribe Neulasta for outpatient administration. Sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks

Posts.Title: Dose dense chemo and Neulasta question

Posts.Content: Hi Marion: Congratulations on finishing chemo and radiation. I am also done now and thought the day would never come. My husband and I just returned from a trip to Kauai. It was wonderful and such a blessing to be able to travel again. I started Aromasin about five weeks ago. I am very stiff upon arising each morning. I have some joint pain in my fingers and knees. I still have neuropathy from the Taxol so can't really assess my toes. Have you found anything to relieve the achy joints? I found that my feet were very swollen after the 4 1/2 plane trip. On your trip to Europe try to get up every hour and walk. Drink plenty of water en route as well. Have a wonderful journey with your daughter.
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen vs Arimidex

Posts.Content: Dear Pastor Rich: I was wondering how you and Cathy were doing. She was diagnosed about the same time that I was. I, too, have finished the chemo...Yeh....I never thought this day would come. I will be starting radiation as well. I am planning a trip to Kauai in June and share your concern about energy levels. I have been told that it takes about as long as treatment to recover your energy level. I don't think anything could make me more tired than chemo. However, I will take it one day at a time. I am finally starting to sleep better which also should help with my energy level. My HGB was low related to the chemo so that should start rebuilding as well. My best to both of you. I will visualize you having a wonderful time in Florida come May. Hugs. Sharon
Posts.Signature: DX: October, 2004,age 59 Lumpectomy with Sentinel node Sentinel node + with 5mm lesion ER/PR + HER2 - Invasive Ductal with 8mm primary lesion Dose Dense AC x 4 with Taxol x4 Radiation x 6weeks
Posts.Title: How did you feel after radiation?
